    "[ thm : gbasis ] the reduced grbner basis of the kernel of @xmath43 consists of quadratic polynomials in @xmath44\\,$ ] which are indexed by pairs of incomparable variables @xmath45 in the poset @xmath46 , @xmath47 and all lower terms @xmath48 in @xmath49 satisfy @xmath50 and @xmath51 .",
    "the join @xmath52 and meet @xmath53 appearing in the above formula are the lattice operations in @xmath54 .",
    "the combinatorial structure of this distributive lattice will become clear in section 2 , when we introduce the toric variety associated with @xmath54 . in section 3",
    "we interpret the subalgebra @xmath55 of @xmath13 $ ] as the coordinate ring of the quantum grassmannian .",
    "section 4 contains the proofs of theorems 1 and 2 .",
    "these results generalize the classical sagbi basis property of maximal minors ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 3.2.9 ) and its geometric interpretation as a toric deformation ( * ? ? ?",
    "* proposition 11.10 ) from the case of the grassmannian to the quantum grassmannian . in section 5",
    "we discuss corollaries , applications and some open problems .",
    "one such application is that the row - consecutive @xmath6-minors of any matrix of indeterminates form a sagbi basis .",
    "we thank aldo conca , ezra miller , and brian taylor for their helpful comments .",
    "theorem 1 asserts that the initial algebra of our subalgebra @xmath56 is generated by the initial monomials of its generators @xmath57 .",
    "our first step is to identify the initial monomials . here",

    "this completes the proof .",
    "( 7.5,7.5)(0,0 ) ( 0 , 0)(1,0)7.5 ( 0,2.5)(1,0)7.5 ( 0 , 5)(1,0)7.5 ( 2.5,7.5)(1,0)5 ( 0 , 0)(0,1)5 ( 2.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 7.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0 )    ' '' ''    we next introduce some combinatorics to help understand the poset @xmath27 .",
    "a _ row _ with shift @xmath79 consists of @xmath3 consecutive empty unit boxes shifted @xmath79 units to the left of a given vertical line .",
    "a _ skew shape _ is an array of such rows whose shifts are weakly increasing read from top to bottom .",
    "for example , the unshaded boxes in the figure on the left form a skew shape ( with shifts 1,2,2 , and 5 ) while those in the other figure do not : @xmath80    a _ ( skew ) tableau _ @xmath81 is a filling of a skew shape with integers that increase across each row . when the entries lie in @xmath82 $ ] , the @xmath83th row of a tableau is a sequence @xmath84}{p}$ ] .",
    "if @xmath85 is the shift of the @xmath83th row and @xmath81 has @xmath86 rows , then @xmath81 corresponds to a monomial @xmath87 .",
    "conversely , any monomial in the variables @xmath23 corresponds to a tableau .",
    "a tableau @xmath81 is _ standard _ if the entries are weakly increasing in each column , read top to bottom .",
    "equivalently , @xmath81 is standard if we have @xmath88 in @xmath27 .",
    "for example , the following two tableaux correspond to the monomials @xmath89 and @xmath90 .",
    "the first tableau is not standard and the second tableau is standard : @xmath91    the elements of the poset @xmath30 are represented by one - row tableaux with entries in @xmath82 $ ] and shift at most @xmath92 .",
    "two elements satisfy @xmath93 if and only if the two - rowed tableau @xmath94 is standard .",
    "this representation implies that @xmath30 is a distributive lattice .",
    "indeed , the two lattice operations @xmath53 and @xmath52 are described as follows .",
    "if a two - rowed tableau @xmath95 is non - standard then interchanging the entries in every column in which a violation ( @xmath96 ) occurs yields a standard tableau .",
    "the first row of this new tableau is the _ meet _ @xmath97 of @xmath23 and @xmath98 in @xmath30 and the second row is their _ join _ @xmath99 .    let @xmath100 \\rightarrow k[x]$ ] denote the @xmath14-algebra homomorphism which sends the variable @xmath23 to the monomial @xmath101 .",
    "its kernel is a _ toric ideal _",
    "( i.e.  binomial prime )  in @xmath102 $ ] .",

    "this follows from hibi s theorem @xcite since @xmath30 is a distributive lattice .",
    "( 7.5,7.5)(0,0 ) ( 0 , 0)(1,0)7.5 ( 0,2.5)(1,0)7.5 ( 0 , 5)(1,0)7.5 ( 2.5,7.5)(1,0)5 ( 0 , 0)(0,1)5 ( 2.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 7.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0 )    ' '' ''    [ cor : standard ] the set of standard tableaux is a @xmath14-basis for @xmath107 / { \\rm kernel}(\\psi ) =   { \\rm image}(\\psi ) $ ] .    here is a typical element in the reduced grbner basis of @xmath108 for @xmath109 : @xmath110 note that the second monomial corresponds to a standard tableau while the first does not .",
    "we write @xmath111 for the projective toric variety cut out by the binomials in lemma [ lem : toric ] .",
    "its coordinate ring is the subalgebra @xmath112 of @xmath13 $ ] .",
    "the geometry of toric varieties associated with distributive lattices is discussed in @xcite .",
    "the analogue to corollary [ cor : standard ] always holds , i.e. , multichains in the poset correspond to basis monomials in the coordinate ring .",
    "[ degree ] the degree of the toric variety @xmath111 is the number of maximal chains in @xmath30 .",
    "the closed intervals of the poset @xmath30 are also distributive lattices .",
    "they are denoted @xmath113 \\quad : = \\quad \\bigl\\ { \\gamma^{(c ) } \\in { \\mathcal c}^q_{p , m } \\ , : \\ , \\beta^{(b ) } \\leq \\gamma^{(c ) } \\leq   \\alpha^{(a ) } \\bigr\\}.\\ ] ] proposition [ lem : toric ] and corollaries [ cor : standard ] and [ degree ] hold essentially verbatim for the distributive sublattice @xmath114\\,$ ] as well . the projective toric variety associated with @xmath114\\,$ ]",
    "is gotten from the toric variety of @xmath30 by setting @xmath115 for all @xmath116 $ ] .",
    "the degree of that variety is the number of saturated chains in @xmath30 which start at @xmath98 and end at @xmath117 .",
    "we close this section with an alternative proof , to be used in section 4 , for the fact that @xmath27 is a distributive lattice .",
    "we claim that @xmath27 is a sublattice of _ young s lattice_. given @xmath118 , write @xmath119 with integers @xmath60 , and define a sequence @xmath120 by @xmath121 this gives an order - preserving bijection between the poset @xmath27 and the poset of sequences @xmath122 of positive integers with @xmath123 , and it preserves meet and join .",
    "this bijection preserves the rank function in the two distributive lattices : @xmath124 the quantum grassmannian ------------------------",
    "let @xmath125 denote the grassmannian of @xmath3-planes in the vector space @xmath126 .",
    "this is a smooth projective variety of dimension @xmath127 .",
    "consider the space @xmath128 of maps @xmath129 of degree @xmath92 .",
    "such a map may be ( non - uniquely ) represented as the row space of a @xmath8-matrix of polynomials in @xmath10 whose maximal minors have degree @xmath92 .",
    "results in @xcite imply that it suffices to consider the matrices @xmath7 in the introduction .",
    "the coefficients of these maximal minors define the _ plcker embedding _ of @xmath128 into @xmath130 ; see @xcite .",
    "the _ quantum grassmannian _",
    "@xmath131 is the zariski closure of @xmath128 in this plcker embedding .",
    "it is an irreducible projective variety of dimension @xmath132 .",
    "its prime ideal is @xmath133\\,$ ] and its coordinate ring is our subalgebra @xmath134 $ ] .",
    "the quantum grassmannian @xmath131 is singular and it differs from other spaces used to study rational curves in grassmann varieties ( the quot scheme  @xcite , the kontsevich space of stable maps  @xcite , or the set of autoregressive systems  @xcite ) .",
    "nevertheless , @xmath131 has been crucial in two important advances : in computing the intersection number @xmath135 in quantum cohomology  @xcite , and in showing that this intersection problem can be fully solved over the real numbers  @xcite .",
    "our result will give a new derivation of this intersection number .",
    "[ cor : counting ] @xcite the degree of @xmath136 is the number of maximal chains in @xmath30 .    * proof .",
    "* this follows immediately from theorem 2 and corollary [ degree ] .",
    "( 7.5,7.5)(0,0 ) ( 0 , 0)(1,0)7.5 ( 0,2.5)(1,0)7.5 ( 0 , 5)(1,0)7.5 ( 2.5,7.5)(1,0)5 ( 0 , 0)(0,1)5 ( 2.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 7.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0 )    ' '' ''",
    "this degree can also be computed in the small quantum cohomology ring of the grassmannian  @xcite .",
    "note that @xmath137 , by counting maximal chains in figure  [ fig : qorder ] .",
    "ravi , rosenthal , and wang @xcite were motivated by a problem in applied mathematics .",
    "the degree of @xmath136 is the number of dynamic feedback compensators that stabilize a certain linear system , in the sense of systems theory .",
    "this number can be described in classical projective geometry as follows .",
    "the schubert subvariety of @xmath125 consisting of @xmath3-planes meeting a fixed @xmath138-plane @xmath139 is a hyperplane section in the plcker embedding of @xmath125 .",
    "thus the set of maps @xmath140 such that @xmath141 meets @xmath139 non - trivially is a hyperplane section of @xmath128 in its plcker embedding .",
    "since @xmath142 acts transitively on @xmath125 , kleiman s theorem on generic transversality implies the following statement when @xmath14 is algebraically closed of characteristic zero .",
    "set @xmath143 and suppose @xmath144 are general points and @xmath145 are general @xmath138-planes in @xmath126 , then the degree of @xmath131 counts those maps @xmath146 for which @xmath147 meets @xmath148 non - trivially for each @xmath149 . as to computing the desired maps @xmath146 numerically",
    ", we note that the sagbi basis in theorem 1 and the grbner basis in theorem 2 each lead to an _ optimal homotopy algorithm _ for finding these @xmath135 maps .",
    "these algorithms generalize the ones in  @xcite .",

    "* equation ( 11.9 ) ) for the simplest example relevant to us , namely , @xmath150 .",
    "the flat deformation is given algebraically by deleting all but the first two terms in the grbner basis elements @xmath151 given in theorem 2 .",

    "let @xmath169 and write @xmath170 with integers @xmath171 .",
    "we define the matrix @xmath172 to be the specialization of @xmath7 where @xmath173 here we use the conventions @xmath174 if @xmath175 and @xmath176 if @xmath177 .",
    "for example , @xmath178.\\ ] ] if we specialize the variables @xmath179 in @xmath172 to field elements in @xmath14 in such a way that the resulting matrix over @xmath180 has maximal row rank , then that matrix defines a map from @xmath14 to @xmath125 .",
    "if we extend this to @xmath181 , we obtain a map in @xmath182 .",
    "proposition  [ itisdominant ] below implies that such maps constitute a dense subset of @xmath182 .",
    "this means that the coefficients with respect to @xmath10 of the maximal minors of @xmath172 give a rational parameterization of @xmath182 .",
    "this construction extends to skew quantum schubert varieties as follows .",
    "given @xmath183 , write @xmath184 with integers @xmath171 and define the matrix @xmath185 to be the specialization of @xmath172 where @xmath186 the matrix @xmath185 gives a rational map into @xmath187 , which is described algebraically as follows .",
    "we define @xmath188 and @xmath189 to be the composition of the map @xmath190 \\rightarrow k[x ] \\,$ ] with the specializations to @xmath172 and @xmath185 respectively .",
    "we claim that these matrices parameterize dense subsets of the ( skew ) quantum schubert varieties .",
    "[ itisdominant ] the kernel of @xmath188 is the homogeneous ideal of the quantum schubert variety @xmath182 .",
    "likewise , the kernel of @xmath189 is the homogeneous ideal of the skew quantum schubert variety @xmath187 . in particular , the varieties @xmath182 and @xmath187 are irreducible .",
    "we postpone the proof of this proposition until the next section .",
    "here is an example which illustrates the parameterization of skew quantum schubert varieties for @xmath191 : @xmath192\\,.\\ ] ] we evaluate the @xmath193-minors of this matrix to find the @xmath14-algebra homomorphism @xmath194 .",
    "it takes polynomials in @xmath195 variables @xmath196 to polynomials in @xmath197 variables @xmath179 as follows : @xmath198 the @xmath195 variables @xmath199 appearing on the left sides above are precisely the elements in the interval @xmath200\\,$ ] of the distributive lattice @xmath201 .",
    "there are @xmath202 incomparable pairs in this interval , each giving a quadratic generator for the kernel of @xmath194 .",
    "this set of @xmath202 quadrics consists of @xmath203 binomials and four trinomials , and it equals the reduced grbner basis with respect to @xmath20 .",
    "for example , one of the 14 binomials in this grbner basis is the underlined leading binomial of @xmath204 in  ( [ bigsyzygy ] ) , and one of the four trinomials is @xmath205 the underlined term is an incomparable pair in @xmath206 $ ] , while the other two monomials are comparable pairs .",
    "erasing the third term gives a binomial as in proposition [ lem : toric ] .",

    "the next lemma provides the initial step in our inductive proof of theorem  [ thm : syzygy ] .",
    "[ lem : initial ] let @xmath199 and @xmath165 be incomparable variables in the poset @xmath54 and set @xmath304",
    ". then @xmath305 .    *",
    "* we prove the lemma by inductively showing that , for each @xmath306 , @xmath307 if @xmath308 , then @xmath309 vanishes , and either @xmath310 vanishes or @xmath311 vanishes .",
    "this implies that  ( [ eq : lt ] ) holds .",
    "next suppose @xmath312 .",
    "we claim that @xmath189 maps each variable appearing in  ( [ eq : lt ] ) to its initial term in @xmath13 $ ] . in view of proposition  [ lem : toric ] , this claim implies  ( [ eq : lt ] ) . to establish this claim ,",
    "we need only show that @xmath313 , as the case for @xmath165 is similar and that of the other terms follow from  ( [ eq : initial ] ) .",
    "consider the expansion of @xmath310 in terms of the minors @xmath226 of @xmath314 .",
    "first observe that the submatrix given by the columns from @xmath315 is block anti - diagonal , with each block either upper or lower triangular along its anti - diagonal .",
    "this is because for each @xmath83 , @xmath316 is either @xmath317 or @xmath318 , and the non - zero entries in the @xmath83th row of @xmath314 lie between these two numbers .",
    "thus the contribution of term @xmath315 to @xmath310 is simply @xmath319 .",
    "we claim there are no other terms .",
    "if there were another term indexed by @xmath139 , then the @xmath139th maximal minor of @xmath314 would be non - zero , and so @xmath320 .",
    "thus @xmath321 comparing the first components of these sequences gives @xmath322 .",
    "since @xmath323 , this implies @xmath324 .",
    "similarly , using @xmath325 , we see that @xmath326 .",
    "lastly , as @xmath139 is a summand in @xmath327 and @xmath328 , we have @xmath329 and thus @xmath330 a contradiction , which proves the claim .",
    "thus  ( [ eq : lt ] ) holds for @xmath312 .",
    "finally , let @xmath331 and suppose that  ( [ eq : lt ] ) holds for all @xmath98 with @xmath332 .",
    "then by lemma  [ lem : factor ] , @xmath333 the sum over sequences @xmath227 of rank @xmath334 . but",
    "this exceeds the rank of @xmath23 , since @xmath331 and @xmath335 .",
    "thus the sum vanishes and so  ( [ eq : lt ] ) holds for all @xmath183 , which proves the lemma .",

    "( 7.5,7.5)(0,0 ) ( 0 , 0)(1,0)7.5 ( 0,2.5)(1,0)7.5 ( 0 , 5)(1,0)7.5 ( 2.5,7.5)(1,0)5 ( 0 , 0)(0,1)5 ( 2.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 7.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0 )    ' '' ''    * proof of proposition [ itisdominant ] . *",
    "if @xmath98 is the minimal element in the poset @xmath27 , then @xmath188 and @xmath189 have the same kernel , as the varieties @xmath187 and @xmath182 are equal .",
    "hence it suffices to prove the second statement about @xmath189 .",
    "clearly , the kernel of @xmath189 contains the homogeneous ideal of the skew quantum schubert variety @xmath187 .",
    "if this containment were proper , then we would also get proper containment at the level of initial ideals with respect to the induced partial term order , which was denoted by @xmath388 in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 11 ) .",
    "but that is impossible since every binomial relation on the monomials @xmath389 lifts to a polynomial which vanishes on @xmath187 , as shown in the proof theorem [ thm : syzygy ] .",
    "( 7.5,7.5)(0,0 ) ( 0 , 0)(1,0)7.5 ( 0,2.5)(1,0)7.5 ( 0 , 5)(1,0)7.5 ( 2.5,7.5)(1,0)5 ( 0 , 0)(0,1)5 ( 2.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 7.5 , 0)(0,1)7.5 ( 5 , 0 )    ' '' ''",
    "we first summarize some algebraic consequences of our main results .",
    "[ asl ] the coordinate ring of the quantum grassmannian @xmath131 is an algebra with straightening law on the distributive lattice @xmath390 .",
    "it has a presentation by a non - commutative grbner basis consisting of quadratic elements , and , in particular , it is a koszul algebra .    * proof . *",
    "the first statement follows from theorem  [ issagbi ] and the form of the syzygies @xmath207 of theorem  [ thm : gbasis ] . for the second statement , consider the coordinate ring of @xmath131 as the quotient of the free associative algebra on @xmath390 modulo a two - sided ideal . by",
    "* proposition 3.2 ) that two - sided ideal has a quadratic grbner basis , obtained from lifting the grbner basis in theorem  [ thm : gbasis ] . for the classical grassmannian @xmath5 this result appeared in @xcite .",
    "the koszul property is a well - known consequence of the existence of a quadratic grbner basis ; see e.g.  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 3 ) for the non - commutative version which is relevant here .          * proof . * by corollary  [ asl ] and the results of  @xcite , these properties of @xmath131 follow from the corresponding properties of the toric variety @xmath111 .",
    "but these were established in  @xcite , as @xmath111 is the toric variety associated to the distributive lattice @xmath30 .",
    "our next application is the sagbi property of the row - consecutive @xmath214-minors of a matrix of indeterminates .",
    "this result is non - trivial since the set of _ all _ @xmath6-minors is not a sagbi basis in general  ( * ? ? ?",
    "* example 11.3 ) .",
    "a finite sagbi basis for the algebra of all @xmath214-minors was found by bruns and conca @xcite .",
    "let @xmath394 be the @xmath395-matrix whose @xmath9th entry is @xmath396 , where @xmath397 .",
    "this matrix is obtained from @xmath217 by stacking the matrices @xmath398 .",
    "let @xmath399\\rightarrow k[x]$ ] denote the @xmath14-algebra homomorphism which sends the variable @xmath23 to the @xmath35th maximal minor of the submatrix of @xmath394 consisting of rows @xmath400 .",
    "thus the collection of polynomials @xmath401 are the row - consecutive @xmath6-minors of @xmath394",
    ".        * proof .",
    "* let @xmath403 be the weight on the variables in @xmath13 $ ] defined by @xmath404 .",
    "then @xmath405 , the initial form of @xmath63 , and we have @xmath406 for all @xmath407 . thus image(@xmath43 ) and image(@xmath408 ) have the same initial algebra , and so we deduce the sagbi property for the polynomials @xmath401 from theorem  [ issagbi ] .",
    "let @xmath409 denote the weight on the variables @xmath54 defined by @xmath410 .",
    "for every incomparable pair @xmath45 in the poset @xmath54 , we define the quadratic polynomial @xmath411 where @xmath207 is the element of the reduced grbner basis for the kernel of @xmath43 . for example",
    ", @xmath412 equals the sum of the first ten terms in ( [ bigsyzygy ] ) .",
    "the weight @xmath409 is equivalent , modulo the homogeneities of @xmath413 , to the induced weight which was denoted by @xmath388 in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* chapter 11 ) .",
    "the only - if direction in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 11.4 ) implies      for the plcker ideal defining the classical grassmannian @xmath5 , an explicit ( but non - reduced ) quadratic grbner basis is known .",
    "it appears in the work of hodge - pedoe @xcite and doubilet - rota - stein @xcite , and it consists of the van der waerden syzygies .",
    "they are discussed in grbner basis language in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 3.1 ) .",
    "our next aim is to introduce an analogous non - reduced grbner basis for the ideal @xmath415 of the quantum grassmannian .",
    "we begin by defining the skew van der waerden syzygies for its initial ideal @xmath416 which consists of the algebraic relations among the row - consecutive minors . given a sequence of integers @xmath417 and any integer @xmath418 ,",
    "let @xmath419 denote @xmath420 , where @xmath35 is the reordering of the sequence @xmath421 and @xmath422 is the sign of the permutation which sorts the sequence @xmath421 .",
    "let @xmath94 with @xmath423 be a non - standard tableau and @xmath83 the smallest index of a violation @xmath424 .",
    "define increasing sequences @xmath425 for a subset @xmath426}{i}$ ] , let @xmath427 be the corresponding numbers from @xmath428 ( in order ) and @xmath429 be the other numbers from @xmath428 , also in order .",
    "define the _ skew van der waerden syzygy _",
    "@xmath430}{i } }    ( a , c_{i^c})^{(a)}\\ \\cdot ( c_i , b)^{(b)}\\ .\\ ] ]      * proof . *",
    "our choice of term order implies @xmath432 .",
    "therefore it suffices to show that @xmath433 .",
    "let @xmath434 be the columns of the submatrix of @xmath394 given by its rows @xmath435 .",
    "the skew van der waerden syzygy @xmath436 is an anti - symmetric , multilinear form in the @xmath437 vectors @xmath438 in @xmath439-space .",
    "the non - reduced grbner basis in proposition [ nonredgb ] can be lifted to the quantum grassmannian as follows .",
    "we define the _ quantum van der waerden syzygy _ of the non - standard tableau @xmath81 to be the unique quadratic polynomial @xmath440 in @xmath387 which satisfies @xmath441 and is a sum of syzygies @xmath207 with @xmath442 .",
    "this syzygy exists by ( [ bfw ] ) and it is unique because the quadratic generators of the initial ideal are @xmath14-linearly independent , and any two such quadratic lifts of @xmath443 in kernel@xmath41 differ by terms whose weights are strictly less than @xmath444 .",
    "for instance , the quantum van der waerden syzygy @xmath445 is the polynomial with @xmath446 terms given in ( [ bigsyzygy ] )",
    ". it would be desirable to find an explicit formula , perhaps in terms of the combinatorial formalism in @xcite , for all of the skew van der waerden syzygies @xmath440 , but at present we have no clue how to do this .",
    "the ideal of the quantum grassmannian @xmath131 contains certain _ obvious relations _ which are derived from the grassmannian @xmath125 . for each @xmath21}{p}$ ] consider the polynomial @xmath447 given any quadratic form @xmath448 in the plcker ideal defining @xmath125 and any @xmath449 , let @xmath450 be the coefficient of @xmath451 in polynomial @xmath452 .",
    "since @xmath452 is a polynomial in @xmath10 which vanishes identically on @xmath131 , each of its coefficients @xmath450 must also vanish on @xmath131 .",
    "we call the collection of quadratic polynomials @xmath450 as @xmath392 ranges over a generating set for the plcker ideal of @xmath125 the _ obvious relations_. rosenthal  @xcite showed the following .",
    "when @xmath453 , the obvious relations coincide with the reduced grbner basis of theorem  [ thm : gbasis ] , in particular , they generate the ideal of the quantum grassmannian @xmath454 .",
    "this is no longer true for @xmath455 .",
    "there are 35 incomparable pairs in @xmath456 , and hence @xmath457 linearly independent quadrics in the plcker ideal of @xmath458 .",
    "these give rise to @xmath459 linearly independent obvious relations but when @xmath460 there are @xmath461 incomparable pairs in @xmath462 .",
    "thus the obvious relations do not generate the homogeneous ideal of @xmath463 .",
    "when @xmath464 or @xmath465 then the obvious relations generate the homogeneous ideal of @xmath463 together with an embedded component supported on the irrelevant ideal .",
    "thus the obvious relations define @xmath463 scheme - theoretically , but not ideal - theoretically .",
    "it remains an open problem whether the the obvious relations define @xmath131 scheme - theoretically .",
    "batyrev et.al .",
    "@xcite applied the familiar sagbi property for the grassmannian in the construction of certain pairs of mirror 3-folds from calabi - yau complete intersections in grassmannians .",
    "we are optimistic that the results in this paper will be similarly useful for researchers in the fascinating interplay of algebraic geometry and theoretical physics .",
    "the classical straightening law for the grassmannian and its schubert varieties were the starting point for the general _ standard monomial theory _ for flag varieties .",
    "for details and references we refer to the recent work on sagbi bases by gonciulea and lakshmibai @xcite .",
    "our results suggest that standard monomial theory might be extended to certain spaces of rational curves in flag varieties generalizing the quantum grassmannian @xmath131 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> the maximal minors of a @xmath0-matrix of univariate polynomials of degree @xmath1 with indeterminate coefficients are themselves polynomials of degree @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> the subalgebra generated by their coefficients is the coordinate ring of the quantum grassmannian , a singular compactification of the space of rational curves of degree @xmath2 in the grassmannian of @xmath3-planes in ( @xmath4)-space . </S>",
    "<S> these subalgebra generators are shown to form a sagbi basis . </S>",
    "<S> the resulting flat deformation from the quantum grassmannian to a toric variety gives a new `` grbner basis style '' proof of the ravi - rosenthal - wang formulas in quantum schubert calculus . </S>",
    "<S> the coordinate ring of the quantum grassmannian is an algebra with straightening law , which is normal , cohen - macaulay , gorenstein and koszul , and the ideal of quantum plcker relations has a quadratic grbner basis . </S>",
    "<S> this holds more generally for skew quantum schubert varieties . </S>",
    "<S> these results are well - known for the classical schubert varieties @xmath5 . </S>",
    "<S> we also show that the row - consecutive @xmath6-minors of a generic matrix form a sagbi basis and we give a quadratic grbner basis for their algebraic relations . </S>"
  ]
}
